title: I Found The Best Amazon KDP Niches For Beginners (Hint: It Isn't Low Content)

tactics.name: Bestseller Category Scanning
tactics.description: Identify profitable niches by analyzing Amazon's bestseller categories and filtering for low-competition, high-demand topics.
steps: Use Amazon's bestseller categories with a US zip code filter
Scroll through subcategories to find self-published books
source_quotes: We want to find cookbooks, fitness books... scroll through these categories and find some potential topics.

tactics.name: bsr_review_ratio
tactics.description: Prioritize niches with more books selling (proof) than competitive books, using BSR and review counts to identify low-competition opportunities
steps: Check BSR for top-selling books in a niche
Compare review counts between competitive and non-competitive books
Focus on niches where 80%+ of books have <250 reviews
caveats: Avoid niches with 8+ competitive books and <2 books with proof
source_quotes: There's more proof that a book with lower reviews will sell than a book that is very competitive with a lot of reviews
If somebody is searching up gluten-free Crock-Pot cookbook for beginners, they're not going to buy a normal gluten-free cookbook

tactics.name: prep_for_reviews
tactics.description: Use Book Bounty to gather review currency before launching to ensure 100+ reviews
steps: Collect review currency during book creation
source_quotes: Getting reviews is only difficult if you publish your book and then ask yourself...

heuristics.name: Proof vs Competition Balance
heuristics.condition: If a niche has 3+ proof books (low reviews/BSR) and <4 competition books (high reviews/BSR), it's viable
source_quotes: Ideally, I want at least three [proof books]... we really don't want more than three or four [competition books]

heuristics.name: low_review_boost
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews < 200, then boost the niche's potential
source_quotes: It's more likely you will actually sell with low reviews than you won't

heuristics.name: boost_low_review_niches
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, boost niche potential
source_quotes: If you prep beforehand...you're just setting yourself up for success

claims.statement: A niche with 3+ proof books (reviews <250, BSR <30,000) and <4 competition books (reviews >600) is viable
source_quotes: There's one book that has less than 250 reviews selling, and there's 12 plus books that have over 600 reviews selling well.

claims.statement: Amazon prioritizes book quality over authorship method (AI vs human writers)
source_quotes: Amazon just cares about the quality of its books, not how it's written

claims.statement: High-quality books with unique angles have higher success potential
source_quotes: Have that unique angle...and you're going to set yourself up for success

niche_patterns.description: Target niche audiences with specific dietary needs and product formats
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines low-competition constraints with targeted demand
source_quotes: Gluten-free cookbook... gluten-free crock-pot cookbook for beginners

niche_patterns.description: Specific problem-solution combinations with clear constraints that drive targeted searches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Aligns with exact search terms while maintaining low competition
source_quotes: They want the Crock-Pot. They just bought it. They're gluten-free. They need recipes
